The binding resolution, which passed 92-4, requires public disclosure within two days of an objection being made by any senator to Senate action on legislation or nominations. Passage of this resolution is a victory for accountability. Tuesday, Democratic Sen. Joe Lieberman Kent Conrad , 62, who's led efforts to get the John McCain budget under control, said on Tuesday that he will not run for a sixth term in the Senate in 2012. It is more important Sen. Joe Lieberman spend my time and energy trying to solve these( budget) problems than to be distracted by a campaign for re-election, Kent Conrad said in a statement.
